frPDFRoberto Di Cosmo1998L'auteur explique pourquoi le quasi-monopole de Microsoft est inadmissible.
Inside the Leviatanhttp://www.theatlantic.com/past/docs/issues/2000/02/002fallows.htm
enHTMLJames Fallows20002A temporary consultant describes the Microsoft inside.
The Halloween Documentshttp://www.catb.org/~esr/halloween
enHTML
Open Source Software - A (New?) Development Methodology (aka Halloween I)http://www.catb.org/~esr/halloween/halloween1.html
enHTMLVinod ValloppillilEric S. Raymond1998811The original document is an internal Microsoft memo written by Valloppillil and descring the state of open source software, its dangers for Microsoft and how the company should reply. This document has leaked out of Microsoft and Raymond got a copy, he added some comments on it. This is a must read if you want to understand Microsoft strategy (in the case you do not already know it yet).
Linux OS Competitive Analysis - The Next Java VM? (aka Halloween II)http://www.catb.org/~esr/halloween/halloween2.html
enHTMLVinod ValloppillilEric S. Raymond1998811This is a second internal Microsoft memo which has leaked three day after the first one. This document is only about Linux.
Microsoft's reaction on the 'halloween memorandum' (aka Halloween III)http://www.catb.org/~esr/halloween/halloween3.html
enHTMLAurelia van den BergEric S. Raymond1998115This is one is not very interesting, but, anyway, it is part of the saga.
When Software Things Were Rotten (aka Halloween IV)http://www.catb.org/~esr/halloween/halloween4.html
enHTMLEric S. Raymond19991The saga is getting humorous.
The Truth, The Whole Truth, and Nothing But The Truthhttp://www.wired.com/wired/archive/8.11/microsoft.html
enHTMLJohn Heilemann200011A very long account of the Microsoft antitrust trial: most data is already known, but some facts are written here for the first time and the author explains his vision of the trial impact on Gate's company.
How Microsoft Lost the API Warhttp://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/APIWar.html
enHTMLJoel Spolsky2004613A personal view of Microsoft's change of upward compatibility management and why MS has lost the language/API war.
Microsoft's love affair with security has lost its passionhttp://www.techrepublic.com/blog/window-on-windows/microsofts-love-affair-with-security-has-lost-its-passion/5072
